definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: We are now in no way to make any further concession in price.
sentences.chinese: 我們應經無法再在價格方面做出讓步了。

sentences.english: It's much cheaper to anticipate rather than respond.
sentences.chinese: 因爲預先做出反應遠比事後補救便宜的多。

sentences.english: Boeing says it found problems in the process used to reach the decision.
sentences.chinese: 波音公司表示他在過去做出決定的過程中發現了問題。

sentences.english: It is suggested that the government should make efforts to set aside an appropriate fund for the vegetable basket program.
sentences.chinese: 人們建議政府應該做出努力，爲菜籃子工程撥出專款。

sentences.english: Still, Japan quickly suspended imports of American long-grain rice.
sentences.chinese: 日本立即做出反應，暫緩對美國長粒大米的進口。

sentences.english: The author firstly reviews the historical evolution of WTO secretariat.
sentences.chinese: 筆者首先從歷史的角度對祕書處做出了追根溯源。

sentences.english: Beveling can be done by using a coarse file or, preferably, a beveling tool.
sentences.chinese: 坡口可以用粗齒銼做出，或者更好的，用去角刀。

sentences.english: In short, they might make better ethical decisions than people.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，它們會比人類做出更恰當的道德判斷。

sentences.english: We need to fix it when we do start eating real food.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要在喫真正的食物時做出改變。

sentences.english: You may want to make changes in your home environment.
sentences.chinese: 本週也許你會希望在你的家庭環境中做出些改變。

sentences.english: Pull the top session of the dress out for the drapery effect both in the front and in the back;
sentences.chinese: 將裙子的前後壓在裏層的部分抽出，做出褶皺的效果。

sentences.english: Today that a panel of arbitrators has decided in favor of our company.
sentences.chinese: 今天仲裁團做出了有利於我們公司的裁決。

sentences.english: The horse answered to its rider's touch.
sentences.chinese: 馬對騎馬人的輕擊做出了反應。

sentences.english: What can we do to make those cheese spread lighter and creamier , also low in fat?
sentences.chinese: 怎樣纔可以做出低脂又美味的起司抹醬呢？

sentences.english: Which areas of the site are they visiting before they make a purchase?
sentences.chinese: 他們在做出購買之前訪問了站點的哪些區域？

sentences.english: In taking such steps offenders are seeking forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 冒犯者以這種做出悔改的方式來尋求當事人的寬恕。

definition: to put out/to come up with/to make (a choice, decision, proposal, response, comment etc)/to issue (a permit, statement, explanation, apology, reassurance to the public etc)/to draw (conclusion)/to deliver (speech, judgment)/to devise (explanation)/to extract

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
to decide (to do something)/to resolve/decision/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]/certainly
to advance/to conduct/underway/in progress/to do/to carry out/to carry on/to execute
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
